newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Dr Solomon's says gaining market share.
newsitem.headline: Dr Solomon's says gaining market share.

text.p: U.K.-based anti-virus software company Dr Solomon's Group Plc, which on Tuesday announced a rise in third quarter earnings, said it was still gaining market share in the United States and Germany.

"We continue to win market share in the U.S. and German markets with bookings growth in local currency of 175 percent and 136 percent for the (third) quarter respectively compared to last year," the company's chief executive Geoff Leary said in a statement received in Brussels.
In sterling, bookings for the third quarter increased 39.4 percent year on year to 12.0 million stg.

"In the U.S. continuing strong corporate licence revenue was complemented by the impact of the successful introduction of our new Dr Solomon's Anti-Virus retail product, aimed at increasing brand awareness," Leary added.
Dr Solomon's net profit on ordinary activities rose to 1.817 million stg in its third quarter, ending February 28, from 850,000 in the year-ago quarter.
